p: The valley of Kashmir in the Himalayan biodiversity hotspot harbors rich biodiversity and invaluable bio-resources, including incredible plant wealth [ 21]. However, this bio-wealth faces myriad of threats, of which invasion by alien species is one of the most severe ones in recent times. Although many mountains are considered relatively immune to invasions compared to surrounding lowland ecosystems [ 22], primarily because only a few of the potential invaders from the lowlands manage to spread along steep climate gradients to high elevations [ 23].
